Content_zh: Schafer: 大部分都是空白的。

Content_zh: Schafer: 這裡是 Double Fine 的冒險遊戲資料。

Content: Let's see how far I got. Let's see.

Content_zh: 這很有趣，因為我當時對遊戲沒有任何構想。

Content_zh: 你知道，我只是在思考它將要講述什麼。

Content_zh: 然後在第一天，我坐下來開始寫作。

Content: There's nothing on the first page.
Content_zh: 第一頁上什麼都沒有。

Content_zh: 然後我在第二頁的末尾寫了一些內容。

Content_zh: 到了第三頁的開頭，基本上我已經有了整個遊戲的構想。

Content_zh: [音樂] Schafer: 三月十三日。

Content_zh: Schafer: 有趣。

Content: I told people, everyone, a lot of people thought that we'd already had an idea for a game.

Content_zh: Schafer: 我只是在想一個假的小資訊來告訴你們，比如說這一切都將圍繞著毛絲鼠。

Content: Did I mention that? I mean, it's obvious.

Content_zh: it's going to be mostly chinchilla based
column5: 一說到「復古冒險」，它就主要基於毛絲鼠，會有很多毛皮技術。

Content: There's going to be a lot of nudity, super-violent.
Content_zh: 會有很多裸體，超暴力。

Content: It's going to be the first actual snuff game.
Content_zh: 這將是第一款真正的刪減遊戲。

Content: I think that's pretty out, that was clear in the Kickstarter pitch.
Content_zh: 我想那已經非常明顯了，在 Kickstarter 的提案中也說得很清楚。

Content: Dutton: Who are you going to kill?
Content_zh: Dutton: 你打算殺誰？

Content: Schafer: The team.
Content_zh: Schafer: 團隊成員。

Content: Dutton: All of them? Ron, as well?
Content_zh: Dutton: 全部嗎？包括 Ron？

Content: Schafer: Yeah. He's only half alive right now anyway.
Content_zh: Schafer: 是的。不管怎樣他現在只活一半。

Content: A lot of people thought we had an idea for a game or a game all designed, ready to go.
Content_zh: 很多人以為我們已經有了一個遊戲的構想，或者一個完整設計好的遊戲，準備開始。

Content: And they're like, of course, they're not idiots.
Content_zh: 他們會覺得，當然，畢竟他們不是傻瓜。

Content: They're going to have something ready to go.
Content_zh: 他們會準備好一些東西。

Content: And I was like, no.
Content_zh: 而我就說，不。

Content: 'Cause I want to do all this, like you know, we're going to document everything and start when the cameras are rolling.
Content_zh: 因為我想做這一切，你知道，我們將記錄一切，並在攝影機開始錄影時才開始。

Content: We're going to document the whole thing.
Content_zh: 我們將記錄整個過程。

Content: And so I didn't have an idea.
Content_zh: 所以我當時沒有構想。

Content: And I was a little scared, except for, I think it's just because now I've been you know, doing this for a long time.
Content_zh: 我有點害怕，除了，我想這只是因為我已經做這個很久了。

Content: I have, you got a certain amount of faith that you will sit down and the ideas will come.
Content_zh: 我有，你有一定的信念，認為只要坐下來，靈感就會來。

Content: Because they come if you just put enough time sitting down with the notebook, writing.
Content_zh: 因為如果你花足夠多的時間坐下來，拿著筆記本寫作，靈感就會來。

Content: Something will happen.
Content_zh: 會有事情發生。

Content: And this is like the first entry in the notebook.
Content_zh: 這就像是筆記本中的第一條記錄。

Content: It's dated 3-15, which I think is the day, it's the day after it closed.
Content_zh: 日期是3月15日，我想那是結束後的那一天。

Content: This morning I came in and this is like the first time I've I had a day after the Kick Starter ended.
Content_zh: 今天早上我進來，這是 Kickstarter 結束後的第一天。

Content: So I thought I'd just actually get to work on this game that we're working on.
Content_zh: 所以我想我會真正開始著手我們正在開發的這款遊戲。

Content: So the first thing I do when I'm working on a game, is I start writing.
Content_zh: 所以當我在開發一款遊戲時，我做的第一件事就是開始寫作。

Content: These are all my notebooks.
Content_zh: 這些都是我的筆記本。

Content: I just started a new notebook and it's already covered with stickers.
Content_zh: 我剛開始用一本新筆記本，已經貼滿了貼紙。

Content: And I start writing, so...
Content_zh: 然後我開始寫，所以……

Content: And I sat down, and the first page is me thinking about a code name for the game.
Content_zh: 我坐下來，第一頁是我在思考遊戲的代號。

Content: Then I'm talking about some girls in the sixth grade for some reason.
Content_zh: 然後出於某種原因，我在談論六年級的幾個女孩。

Content: And then I'm complaining about my memory problems.
Content_zh: 然後我在抱怨我的記憶問題。

Content: It's about like, the process of getting ideas out of your head.
Content_zh: 這就像是將腦中的想法釋放出來的過程。

Content: So when I'm really disciplined and on it, I will come in every morning and lock myself in my office
Content_zh: 所以當我非常自律並專注時，我每天早上都會進來，把自己鎖在辦公室裡

Content: and just do free writing.
Content_zh: 然後進行自由寫作。

Content: And free writing is something I actually learned in junior high school, but I started doing a lot in college
Content_zh: 而自由寫作是我實際上在初中學到的，但我在大學時開始大量進行

Content: because it's the way of getting past that hump of like the blank page.
Content_zh: 因為這是克服像空白頁這樣障礙的方法。

Content: It's kind of intimidating. Want me show you one?
Content_zh: 這有點令人畏懼。要我給你看一個嗎？

Content: Scary!
Content_zh: 好可怕！

Content: What do you put on here? Oh, god, you know.
Content_zh: 你會在這裡寫些什麼？哦，天啊，你知道的。

Content: And then, and then I'm like going over this list of old ideas, like what.
Content_zh: 然後，我會翻看這些舊構想的清單，像是什麼。

Content: And then I'm talking about whether I should hire this person, but then, because like, this is ,
Content_zh: 然後我在討論是否應該雇用這個人，但因為，這是，

Content: this is where I sit down in the morning and I start writing.
Content_zh: 這是我早上坐下來開始寫作的地方。

Content: And I have to keep writing. And that's why ridiculous things come out.
Content_zh: 我必須繼續寫下去。這就是為什麼會出現荒謬的內容。

Content: And I started this morning for the first time on Double Fine Adventure.
Content_zh: 我今天早上第一次開始在 Double Fine Adventure 上寫作。

Content: Double Fine Adventure Adventure.
Content_zh: Double Fine Adventure 冒險。

Content: I don't even want to show you what I'm writing, because someone's going to like download it and be like, I've decoded the first notes.
Content_zh: 我甚至不想給你看我在寫什麼，因為有人可能會下載並說，我已經解碼了第一筆記。

Content: And now I start talking about the game.
Content_zh: 然後我開始談論這個遊戲。

Content: And now I start thinking about, should I do this idea?
Content_zh: 然後我開始思考，我是否應該採用這個構想？

Content: I've been thinking about this, this idea.
Content_zh: 我一直在思考這個，這個構想。

Content: I've been thinking about this idea and then right here, you can see there's a little star and a line,
Content_zh: 我一直在思考這個構想，然後就在這裡，你可以看到有一個小星星和一條線，

Content: like this is where I had the idea for the game.
Content_zh: 像這樣，這是我對遊戲構想的地方。

Content: So at least, it took at least three pages.
Content_zh: 所以至少，這花了至少三頁。

Content: Schafer: Well, I can't tell you that, because I'm not sure if I like it or not.
Content_zh: Schafer: 嗯，我不能告訴你，因為我不確定我是否喜歡它。

Content: And it seemed like, sometimes it seems like you're not having any ideas, but you realize as you go over the last week there are like,
Content_zh: 而且看起來，有時候似乎你沒有任何想法，但當你回顧過去一週時，你會發現，

Content: every day had some little tiny thing that moved it forward.
Content_zh: 每天都有一些微小的事情推動它向前發展。

Content: And it's like you've got to move forward a little bit, because you get to that next deep well of ideas, you know.
Content_zh: 就像你必須往前推進一點，因為你會到達下一個深層的創意源泉，你知道的。

Content: The first day, the most productive day like, oh, it can fit together like this. This is great.
Content_zh: 第一天，最有成效的一天，像是，哦，可以這樣組合。這太棒了。

Content: And then, then I get a couple more ideas.
Content_zh: 然後，我又有了幾個新的構想。

Content: You can see the stars and the stars here.
Content_zh: 你可以看到這裡有星星和星星。

Content: And there're some days where no stars happen.
Content_zh: 而有些日子則沒有任何靈感湧現。

Content: And I start writing the name ideas down here as you've seen before.
Content_zh: 然後我開始把名字的想法寫在這裡，就像你之前看到的那樣。

Content: Because I do a lot, you do a lot of name brainstorming where you just write, ah, write down all these dumb names, trying to come up the name of the character.
Content_zh: 因為我做了很多，你們也做了很多命名的頭腦風暴，你會寫下，啊，寫下所有這些愚蠢的名字，試圖想出角色的名字。

Content: I remember there's a page where I came up with the name Grim Fandango and wrote it really big and I was pretty excited about it.
Content_zh: 我記得有一頁我想出了 Grim Fandango 這個名字，並且用了很大的字體寫下來，我對此感到相當興奮。

Content: Here's a copy of my notebook for Grim Fandango.
Content_zh: 這是我 Grim Fandango 筆記本的副本。

Content: Let's see. Here's me talking about Mexican folklore and then here's me trying to figure out the name of the game.
Content_zh: 讓我們看看。這裡是我在談論墨西哥民俗，然後是我在試圖弄清楚遊戲名稱。

Content: Dead Leads. Deadly Deeds.
Content_zh: Dead Leads. Deadly Deeds.

Content: Deeds of Death. Death's Deeds.
Content_zh: Deeds of Death. Death's Deeds.

Content: Here's trying to come up with ideas for the name.
Content_zh: 這裡是在試圖想出名稱的構想。

Content: Reapers Holiday. Reapers Road Trip. Reapers Rendezvous.
Content_zh: Reapers Holiday. Reapers Road Trip. Reapers Rendezvous.

Content: Reapers Last Ride. Reapers Road. Trail of the Reaper.
Content_zh: Reapers Last Ride. Reapers Road. Trail of the Reaper.

Content: Tools of the Reaper. Death as a Salesman. Oh, that's been taken.
Content_zh: Tools of the Reaper. Death as a Salesman. 哦，那已經被使用了。

Content: Reaper Man. That's pretty good, Reaper Man.
Content_zh: Reaper Man. 那不錯，Reaper Man。

Content: The Remorseful Reaper. Bone to Lose.
Content_zh: The Remorseful Reaper. Bone to Lose.

Content: Glen Gary Glen Reaper. Fear the Reaper.
Content_zh: Glen Gary Glen Reaper. Fear the Reaper.

Content: Growl Reaper. Dougie Reaper. Dougie Reaper?
Content_zh: Growl Reaper. Dougie Reaper. Dougie Reaper?

Content: Reaping Ivy. Bony Manifesto. Friendly Reaper.
Content_zh: Reaping Ivy. Bony Manifesto. Friendly Reaper.

Content: Chimp Reaper. That would have been good.
Content_zh: Chimp Reaper. 那會不錯。

Content: Oh, no. Not again.
Content_zh: 哦，不。又來了。

Content: Grim Journey. Hungry Hunted. The Last Reap. The Final Reap.
Content_zh: Grim Journey. Hungry Hunted. The Last Reap. The Final Reap.

Content: I put a box around the Last Reap.
Content_zh: 我在 The Last Reap 周圍畫了一個框。

Content: Like that must have been a favorite idea for a while.
Content_zh: 看起來那一定是持續一段時間的最愛想法。

Content: Grim Reaper. Grim Reaper. I'm still doing it.
Content_zh: Grim Reaper. Grim Reaper. 我還在這麼做。

Content: You can tell my fear is starting to mount, as I'm like, am I ever going to come up with a name for this game?
Content_zh: 你可以看出我的恐懼感開始增強，像是，我是否能為這款遊戲想出一個名字？

Content: Oh my God. Ah! Something otherworld.
Content_zh: 哎呀我的天。啊！一些超凡的東西。

Content: Something figures. The Last Fiesta. Grim Fandango.
Content_zh: 一些形象。The Last Fiesta. Grim Fandango.

Content: I'm such a fucking genius.
Content_zh: 我真是個該死的天才。

Content: Ah, you can see what a relief that was.
Content_zh: 啊，你可以看出那是多麼大的鬆一口氣。

Content: Offscreen Voice: I guess it's been a real long time since you made a 2-D adventure game.
Content_zh: 螢幕外的聲音: 我猜你已經很久沒有做過2D冒險遊戲了。

Content: Schafer: Um hm.
Content_zh: Schafer: 嗯哼。

Content: Dutton: But do you think you've still got it?
Content_zh: Dutton: 但你覺得你還擁有那份能力嗎？

Content: Like, you still, are you still in touch with those skills?
Content_zh: 像是，你還是，還保持著那些技能嗎？

Content: Schafer: And actually I've been doing like, I've been doing these interviews and surveys and you know,
Content_zh: Schafer: 其實我一直在做這些，我一直在做這些訪談和調查，你知道，

Content: discussions, like you know, about trying to figure out adventure games, history and what was good and bad and what we can change about them.
Content_zh: 討論，像是你知道的，試圖了解冒險遊戲的歷史，哪些是好的，哪些是不好的，以及我們可以改變什麼。

Content: Wolpaw: These are all the ones you made, right?
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 這些都是你製作的，對嗎？

Content: And along the wall? Grim Fandango? I played Grim Fandango.
Content_zh: 然後沿著牆嗎？Grim Fandango？我玩過 Grim Fandango。

Content: Monkey Island, didn't play. Day of the Tentacle, I didn't play.
Content_zh: 猴島，我沒玩過。Day of the Tentacle，我也沒玩過。

Content: Full Throttle, I didn't. Psychonauts is good.
Content_zh: Full Throttle，我沒玩過。Psychonauts 還不錯。

Content: Schafer: Yeah, yeah. The writing was half good.
Content_zh: Schafer: 是的，是的。寫作一半不錯。

Content: Wolpaw: Yeah. There was... half of it was pretty good.
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 是的。有……其中一半相當不錯。

Content: But yeah. I don't know. You're making an adventure game.
Content_zh: 但還是，不知道。你正在製作一款冒險遊戲。

Content: You going to do something different to make it better?
Content_zh: 你會做些不同的事情來讓它變得更好嗎？

Content: Schafer: I'm trying to split up what was good about them and what was, what have we learned since and what was better.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我正在試圖分辨它們的優點，以及我們自那以來學到了什麼，什麼是更好的。

Content: What could be made better about them.
Content_zh: 什麼地方可以做得更好。

Content: 'Cause I don't want to make it just like a nostalgia thing.
Content_zh: 因為我不想讓它僅僅成為一種懷舊的東西。

Content: Schafer: I think it's interesting to think about why people like adventure games.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我覺得思考人們為什麼喜歡冒險遊戲很有趣。

Content: And really what they like about them.
Content_zh: 以及他們到底喜歡它們的什麼。

Content: Not just like someone who remembers, Monkey Island from like, oh, when I was 12 I played Monkey Island. I'd love to go play that again.
Content_zh: 不僅僅是像有些人記得，猴島，像是，哦，當我12歲時我玩過猴島。我很想再玩一次。

Content: But who are actually playing them now and like what they actually enjoy about them.
Content_zh: 而是真正現在在玩它們的人，以及他們實際上享受它們的哪些方面。

Content: Gilbert: Why is that a game like, you know, Monkey Island or Maniac Mansion that was made, you know, 20 years ago,
Content_zh: Gilbert: 為什麼像猴島或 Maniac Mansion 這樣的遊戲，知道的，20年前製作的，

Content: why is it that people still love those games?
Content_zh: 人們還是喜歡那些遊戲的原因是什麼？

Content: Why is it that people post hundreds of videos on YouTube of themselves playing the music from those games?
Content_zh: 為什麼人們會在 YouTube 上發佈數百個他們玩那些遊戲音樂的視頻？

Content: What, what was it about those that, that really was so interesting and touched people like that?
Content_zh: 那些遊戲中，有什麼讓它們如此有趣並觸動人心？

Content: Gilbert: So is a lot of the interest that people have today in adventure games, is that more, do you think that's more nostalgia based?
Content_zh: Gilbert: 那麼，人們今天對冒險遊戲的興趣，大部分是基於懷舊嗎？

Content: Because there're a lot of people who love adventure games, but do they love the nostalgia of them as opposed to the actual adventure games?
Content_zh: 因為有很多人愛冒險遊戲，但他們是愛懷舊感，而不是實際的冒險遊戲本身嗎？

Content: Gilbert: You know, you want to do something that really focuses on what made those old point-and-click adventure games a lot of fun
Content_zh: Gilbert: 你想做一些真正專注於那些老式點擊冒險遊戲有趣之處的事情

Content: and I mean, there's just like a rabid fan base for those things as we obviously saw.
Content_zh: 我是說，這些東西有一個狂熱的粉絲群，正如我們明顯看到的。

Content: So you know, you really want to take from those games what made them really special.
Content_zh: 所以你真的想從那些遊戲中汲取使它們特別的元素。

Content: But I also don't think you just want to go make a 2-D point-and-click adventure game,
Content_zh: 但我也不認為你只是想去做一款2D點擊冒險遊戲，

Content: you know, with the little cursor that moves around and all that.
Content_zh: 你知道的，配有那個移來移去的小光標之類的。

Content: Because I could never go back and just design Monkey Island again, because I'm a different person today, you know, than I was back then.
Content_zh: 因為我永遠無法回去重新設計猴島，因為我今天是不同的人了，你知道的，和當時的我不同。

Content: The world has changed. Gamers have changed, you know, we've changed.
Content_zh: 世界已經改變了。玩家已經改變了，你知道，我們也改變了。

Content: And so there's a lot, I think there's a lot that has to evolve in them and you know, I don't know exactly what those are off the top of my head.
Content_zh: 所以我覺得它們中有很多東西必須演變，而你知道，我立刻想不出那些具體是什麼。

Content: But they do need to evolve, but they need to evolve in such a way that they don't lose the spirit of them
Content_zh: 但它們確實需要演變，並且需要以不失去其精神的方式演變

Content: and they don't lose what made them so interesting to people.
Content_zh: 而且它們不會失去讓人們如此感興趣的特質。

Content: Schafer: The things that came up most, when we talked about what was good about adventure games were the pacing of them.
Content_zh: Schafer: 當我們討論冒險遊戲的優點時，最常提到的是它們的節奏。

Content: I think that's important that people like a game that moves at their pace.
Content_zh: 我認為很重要的是人們喜歡一款能夠按照他們的節奏前進的遊戲。

Content: I mean, obviously story and characters, even though the games have those, I still think adventure games are the genre that still puts them as the number one thing.
Content_zh: 我是說，顯然故事和角色，儘管遊戲中有這些，我仍然認為冒險遊戲是那個仍然將它們作為首要元素的類型。

Content: Schafer: Hi, guys. I'm late for another meeting.
Content_zh: Schafer: 嗨，大家好。我又遲到了另一個會議。

Content: Schafer: You can talk about now or back then.
Content_zh: 你們可以談談現在還是過去的情況。

Content: What you remember as the like, dislike the most about adventure games and the most frustrating moments you had?
Content_zh: 你們記得對冒險遊戲最喜歡和最不喜歡的部分，以及你們遇到的最沮喪的時刻是什麼？

Content: Who wants to answer that one first?
Content_zh: 誰想先回答這個？

Content: Chi: Pixel hunting, for sure. That was really frustrating.
Content_zh: Chi: 當然是像素狩獵。那真的讓人非常沮喪。

Content: Schafer: Do you remember an example of that?
Content_zh: Schafer: 你記得一個例子嗎？

Content: Chi: I think it was either in A King's Quest or Gabriel Knight game.
Content_zh: Chi: 我覺得是在《A King's Quest》或《Gabriel Knight》遊戲中。

Content: Schafer: It's going to seem fishy if you only pick Sierra games for the bad example.
Content_zh: Schafer: 如果你只舉 Sierra 的遊戲作為不好的例子，會顯得有點可疑。

Content: Chi: Well, that's, that's the thing.
Content_zh: Chi: 嗯，那就是重點。

Content: Because the Lucas Arts games had the same thing.
Content_zh: 因為 Lucas Arts 的遊戲也有同樣的問題。

Content: Schafer: I've already apologized for that one.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我已經為那個道歉了。

Content: Schafer: One of the interesting advantages of adventure, well, I was thinking about the, a lot of people I talked to
Content_zh: Schafer: 冒險遊戲的一個有趣優勢，嗯，我在思考，很多我談過的人

Content: had the same experience of early adventure, the first adventure game experience was like this promise of infinite possibility.
Content_zh: 都有相同的早期冒險遊戲經驗，第一次玩冒險遊戲的感覺就像是承諾了無限的可能。

Content: LeBreton: When I first started playing adventure games, I was like a kid and I didn't really understand games.
Content_zh: LeBreton: 當我第一次開始玩冒險遊戲時，我還是個孩子，並不真正理解遊戲。

Content: Games were still magical to me so I'd boot it up and I had no idea of what to expect. Like I had a Commodore 64.
Content_zh: 遊戲對我來說仍然是神奇的，所以我會啟動它，完全不知道會發生什麼。就像我有一臺 Commodore 64。

Content: You know, just like, I don't know, it just created this feeling of completely crazy, open-ended possibility.
Content_zh: 你知道，就像，我不知道，它只是創造了一種完全瘋狂、開放式可能性的感覺。

Content: Schafer: That's hard to still execute on that promise of infinite possibility I think with a modern adventure game.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我認為在現代冒險遊戲中，仍然要實現那種無限可能性的承諾是很困難的。

Content: When you were playing Machinarium you don't have that feeling like, I'm Mr. Robot and I can do whatever I want in this world.
Content_zh: 當你玩 Machinarium 時，你不會有那種感覺，像我是 Mr. Robot，我可以在這個世界上做任何我想做的事情。

Content: It's more like this game about finding where the interaction is and what are the, what are all the interactions I can have in this world.
Content_zh: 這更像是一款關於尋找互動的位置，以及我在這個世界上可以進行的所有互動的遊戲。

Content: Dvorsky: It should be more about playing with the game than trying to beat it as soon as possible.
Content_zh: Dvorsky: 它應該更多地關注與遊戲的互動，而不是盡快擊敗它。

Content: So you should be able to enjoy some places and situations, even for several times, even if you solved it already.
Content_zh: 所以即使你已經解決了，你也應該能夠多次享受某些地點和情境。

Content: It should be fun to play that little puzzle or little interactive toy, again just for fun.
Content_zh: 再次強調，玩那個小謎題或小互動玩具應該是有趣的，只是為了好玩。

Content: Wolpaw: I mean, I like that they have a, that they were funny.
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 我的意思是，我喜歡他們有趣的一面。

Content: They're kind of whimsical. I guess I just didn't like the puzzles maybe.
Content_zh: 它們有點異想天開。我猜我只是可能不喜歡那些謎題。

Content: Schafer: Puzzles.
Content_zh: Schafer: 謎題。

Content: So you would say you would never advocate a game that had puzzles in it?
Content_zh: 所以你會說你永遠不會推薦包含謎題的遊戲嗎？

Content: Wolpaw: No. No.
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 不了。不。

Content: Schafer: Like Portal, for example.
Content_zh: Schafer: 比如說《Portal》。

Content: Schafer: One of the big questions was whether or not games should have puzzles in them, in adventure games.
Content_zh: Schafer: 一個大問題是，冒險遊戲中的遊戲是否應該包含謎題。

Content: That came up when we were talking to the Super Brothers, Craig and Chris.
Content_zh: 當我們與 Super Brothers 的 Craig 和 Chris 談話時，這個問題就出現了。

Content: About Sword and Sorcery, about how when they played the old adventure games the thing that didn't hold up for them was the puzzles,
Content_zh: 關於《Sword and Sorcery》，關於他們玩老冒險遊戲時，那些對他們來說無法持續的是謎題，

Content: because there were these blocks to the flow.
Content_zh: 因為那些對遊戲進程的阻礙。

Content: They really wanted the flow to happen.
Content_zh: 他們真的希望遊戲進程能夠順暢。

Content: Adams: And actually those types of mechanics, that sort of inventory puzzles, are things that I don't miss from older adventure games.
Content_zh: Adams: 其實那些類型的機制，那種庫存謎題，是我不懷念老冒險遊戲中的東西。

Content: What I love about older adventure games is that there's, you have a flow and there's a story and there's characters.
Content_zh: 我喜歡老冒險遊戲的是，它們有流暢的進程、有故事、有角色。

Content: And it just kind of surprises you.
Content_zh: 然後它們會讓你感到驚喜。

Content: And it was never figuring out, you know, which little pixel and which screen do I combine with the other.
Content_zh: 而且你從來不需要搞清楚，你知道，哪個小像素和哪個畫面應該與另一個結合。

Content: So, but we tried to make it more just flow.
Content_zh: 所以，我們試著讓它更流暢。

Content: Schafer: I thought about that for a long time.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我考慮了很久。

Content: It was like, is that, are puzzles an antiquated, you know, notion for these games?
Content_zh: 那是，謎題對於這些遊戲來說是一個過時的概念嗎？

Content: Are they a block to the narrative flow?
Content_zh: 它們妨礙敘事的流暢嗎？

Content: But I felt like in the end that wasn't the case for the game we were making.
Content_zh: 但我覺得最終對我們正在製作的遊戲而言，情況並非如此。

Content: I think the game they were making was a really specific, like for what they wanted to make,
Content_zh: 我認為他們正在製作的遊戲是非常具體的，就像他們想要製作的那樣，

Content: it wouldn't have suited their purposes to have a bunch of like, head scratchers.
Content_zh: 擁有一堆讓人挠頭的謎題不符合他們的目的。

Content: Piotrowski: But that was really a challenging moment.
Content_zh: Piotrowski: 但那確實是一個具有挑戰性的時刻。

Content: It was kind of like trying to shed some of those things that were like buried in our heads from playing all these games when we were kids.
Content_zh: 那有點像是試圖擺脫那些從小玩這些遊戲時埋在我們腦海中的東西。

Content: Schafer: Like what, talking about adventure games, people's memories of playing adventure games when they were kids.
Content_zh: Schafer: 比如說，談論冒險遊戲，人們在童年時玩冒險遊戲的回憶。

Content: So many of them were like, that's the only thing I had to do that summer.
Content_zh: 他們中有許多人會說，那是那個夏天我唯一做的事情。

Content: I got stuck in my grandma's house for the summer and I played Day of the Tentacle every day.
Content_zh: 我整個夏天都被困在奶奶家，每天都玩《Day of the Tentacle》。

Content: Like, I mean, people have so many options now for entertainment.
Content_zh: 就像，我的意思是，人們現在有這麼多娛樂選擇。

Content: It's going to be really hard to make sure that there's something really sticky about the game that makes them want to come back.
Content_zh: 確保遊戲中有些真正吸引人的元素讓他們想要回來，這將會非常困難。

Content: I think a lot of that is atmosphere. For me.
Content_zh: 我覺得其中很大一部分是氛圍。對我來說。

Content: Like, when I, you know, you feel haunted by a game sometimes.
Content_zh: 就像，當我，你知道，你有時會被一款遊戲所困擾。

Content: Like you're just at your work or you're at school and you think about the music and you think about the world
Content_zh: 就像你在工作或在學校時，你會想到音樂，想到那個世界

Content: and you're like, I really, that world feels so real that you want to go back there.
Content_zh: 然後你會覺得，我真的覺得那個世界如此真實，你想回到那裡。

Content: That's the goal on it.
Content_zh: 那就是它的目標。

Content: You know, that's the way you keep people playing an adventure game.
Content_zh: 你知道的，這就是讓人們持續玩冒險遊戲的方式。

Content: Wolpaw: So anyway, did that help?
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 無論如何，那有幫助嗎？

Content: Is what I'm telling you helping at all?
Content_zh: 我告訴你的有幫助嗎？

Content: Schafer: Don't try to improve adventure games because they're always bad.
Content_zh: Schafer: 不要試圖改進冒險遊戲，因為它們總是很糟。

Content: Just make an old bad one.
Content_zh: 只是做一個老舊的壞的。

Content: Wolpaw: Yeah, make one of your old bad ones.
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 是的，做一個你們以前做的壞的那種。

Content: Schafer: Ok, good. Well, thank you Eric Wolpaw for coming.
Content_zh: Schafer: 好的，很好。嗯，謝謝 Eric Wolpaw 來。

Content: And spreading your special brand of love.
Content_zh: 並傳播你獨特的愛。

Content: Wolpaw: Yeah, I mean, I'm just kidding.
Content_zh: Wolpaw: 是的，我是說，我只是在開玩笑。

Content: I really do think the adventure game you make will be about as good as the old ones you made.
Content_zh: 我真的認為你們製作的冒險遊戲將會和你們以前做的那些一樣好。

Content: [music] Schafer: Oh, man. I love looking at this font. It just makes me so happy. It takes me back.
Content_zh: [音樂] Schafer: 喔，天啊。我喜歡看這種字體。它讓我感到非常開心。帶我回到過去。

Content: We should do one of these games.
Content_zh: 我們應該做其中一款遊戲。

Content: Point-and-click adventures are awesome.
Content_zh: 點擊冒險遊戲真是太棒了。

Content: Schafer: I repeat a lot, I kind of recap sometimes, like where I am so far, like what I have.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我經常重複，有時候我會回顧一下，像是到目前為止我在哪裡，有什麼。

Content: Activities in one story affect the other, customizing.
Content_zh: 一個故事中的活動會影響另一個，進行自定義。

Content: This is a drawing that I hope will become the title for the box, cover of the box.
Content_zh: 這是一幅我希望能成為盒子標題、封面的畫。

Content: Here's story boards about the same intro.
Content_zh: 這裡是關於同一導入部分的故事板。

Content: I started writing some, no, I'm not going to read you those names yet.
Content_zh: 我開始寫了一些，不，我還不會給你讀那些名字。

Content: And there's a certain point you just kind of instinctively know, ok, now I need to talk to somebody.
Content_zh: 然後有一個點，你會本能地知道，好的，現在我需要和某人談談。

Content: Because you kind of feel like, ok, this is as far as I can go right now with what's in my head.
Content_zh: 因為你會有一種感覺，好吧，這就是我目前能夠在腦海中進行的程度。

Content: Schafer: So I was thinking about this game.
Content_zh: Schafer: 所以我在想這款遊戲。

Content: And I had an idea.
Content_zh: 然後我有了一個想法。

Content: Well, the first thing I did, well, forget about it now.
Content_zh: 嗯，我做的第一件事，好吧，現在先不要管它。

Content: Let me start over, ok.
Content_zh: 讓我重新開始，好嗎。

Content: Gilbert: Would you like to read your notes?
Content_zh: Gilbert: 你想讀讀你的筆記嗎？

Content: Schafer: And then you talk to somebody who you feel, ok, you're kind of taking a risk,
Content_zh: Schafer: 然後你和某個人談話，你覺得，好吧，你有點在冒險，

Content: because you're exposing all your ideas to somebody for the first time and they might laugh at you.
Content_zh: 因為你第一次把所有想法展現給某個人，他們可能會笑你。

Content: Schafer: My idea for the story, the story idea for this game is about two stories, kind of happening side by side about a boy and a girl.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我這款遊戲的故事構想是關於兩個故事，類似於一個男孩和一個女孩的故事並行發生。

Content: And they're in totally different worlds and at different places.
Content_zh: 而且他們處於完全不同的世界和不同的地方。

Content: Gilbert: Different realities or just different places they go?
Content_zh: Gilbert: 不同的現實還是他們只是去不同的地方？

Content: Schafer: Well, that's a good question. That's an interesting question.
Content_zh: Schafer: 嗯，那是一個好問題。那是一個有趣的問題。

Content: Gilbert: I'm jumping ahead. Schafer: We don't know.
Content_zh: Gilbert: 我有點超前了。Schafer: 我們還不知道。

Content: Schafer: Mostly I just get this relief that I told somebody about the game and they didn't tell me it was stupid.
Content_zh: Schafer: 大部分時候，我只是感到鬆一口氣，因為我告訴了某人這款遊戲的事，他們沒有說它很蠢。

Content: But maybe they'll get inspired and they'll say a whole bunch of other things.
Content_zh: 但也許他們會受到啟發，並說出很多其他的想法。

Content: Then you can take back into the cave with you and like, ah, now I have a whole bunch of stuff to chew on and like,
Content_zh: 然後你可以帶回洞穴，像是，啊，現在我有一大堆東西需要消化，並且，

Content: ideas to bounce around and more dots to play with.
Content_zh: 有想法可以碰撞，還有更多的點子可以玩耍。

Content: It's hard to tell your ideas to people.
Content_zh: 把你的想法告訴別人很難。

Content: Schafer: That mostly sets it up, except for my awesome story boards that I did.
Content_zh: Schafer: 這基本上為它設定了基礎，除了我做的那些很棒的故事板。

Content: That was the idea for the intro.
Content_zh: 那是導入的想法。

Content: See, he's leaning, they're leaning against that wall and he's in a spaceship.
Content_zh: 瞧，他在倚靠，他們倚靠在那面牆上，而他在一艘太空船裡。

Content: And she's looking at a castle.
Content_zh: 而她在看一座城堡。

Content: Gilbert: And then you just choose then, one you want to start with?
Content_zh: Gilbert: 然後你就選擇你想從哪個開始？

Content: Schafer: Yeah.
Content_zh: Schafer: 是的。

Content: Schafer: The story so far, the reason I'm excited about it is that I've never done a story about this type, like this age of character.
Content_zh: Schafer: 到目前為止，讓我感到興奮的原因是，我從未寫過這種類型的故事，像是這種年齡段的角色。

Content: Like a coming of age story.
Content_zh: 像是成長故事。

Content: About a boy and a girl, something about that the pairing of those like equal stories going on at the same time.
Content_zh: 關於一個男孩和一個女孩，關於那些像是同時進行的平行故事的配對。

Content: And the things I guess that are interesting about that age to me are, it's an age where you're learning to take control and take some power in your life
Content_zh: 而我認為那個年齡的有趣之處在於，這是一個你學會掌控和獲取生活中一些權力的年紀

Content: and also the responsibility that goes along with that.
Content_zh: 以及與之相伴的責任。

Content: You know, you're learning that you have power in your life and you're learning you have the power to control your destiny.
Content_zh: 你知道的，你在學習你在生活中擁有權力，你在學習你有能力控制自己的命運。

Content: You have the power to hurt people and then kind of, you know, becoming an adult or becoming a young adult is about learning that
Content_zh: 你有能力傷害別人，然後，知道的，成為成年人或年輕成年人就是要學會那些

Content: you can grab the wheel of your life and steer it in a different direction.
Content_zh: 你可以掌握你人生的方向盤，並將其引導到不同的方向。

Content: I think that's, but then you take the responsibility for what you've done.
Content_zh: 我覺得那是，但然後你要對你所做的事情負責。

Content: And now no one's telling you, you know, that you're going to be ok if you go in this direction, because you've chosen to do it.
Content_zh: 而且現在沒有人告訴你，你知道的，如果你朝這個方向去，你會沒事，因為你選擇這樣做。

Content: Gilbert: I think it's a really creative idea, but I don't think it's the kind of thing that we want to fund at this moment.
Content_zh: Gilbert: 我認為這是個非常有創意的想法，但我不認為這是我們此刻想要資助的類型。

Content: Schafer: That's great. That's so funny because that's so crazy.
Content_zh: Schafer: 那太好了。那太有趣了，因為那太瘋狂了。

Content: Schafer: No. I mean, in some ways it's too early for feedback.
Content_zh: Schafer: 不。我是說，在某些方面，現在對反饋來說還太早了。

Content: I mean, unless I'm totally am like, stealing an idea from something, because you can't say whether an idea is good or not in some ways in the beginning,
Content_zh: 我是說，除非我完全是在偷取某個東西的想法，因為在某些方面，一開始你無法說出一個想法是否好，

Content: because so much is about the execution or the specifics of like how, you know.
Content_zh: 因為很多都是關於執行或具體細節，比如如何，你知道的。

Content: Because it's kind of, it's kind of a vague pitch in a way.
Content_zh: 因為從某種程度上說，這種推介有點模糊。

Content: It's like I want to do, I want to do this game that's about two stories, about a boy and a girl in really separate different worlds
Content_zh: 就像我想做，我想做這款關於兩個故事的遊戲，關於一個男孩和一個女孩在完全分開不同的世界中

Content: who are navigating this space in between them.
Content_zh: 他們在彼此之間的空間中導航。

Content: You know, like that could mean a lot of different things.
Content_zh: 你知道的，像這種可能意味著很多不同的事情。

Content: That could be told many different ways.
Content_zh: 那可以用很多不同的方式來講述。

Content: So it's really hard for anyone to say like, oh, that's a good idea.
Content_zh: 所以真的很難讓任何人說，哦，這是一個好主意。

Content: But I mean, because I do have, you do have some idea of how you're going to do it but you can't articulate all of it.
Content_zh: 但我的意思是，因為我確實有，你確實有一些如何去做的想法，但你無法完整表達出來。

Content: Schafer: I'm ready for you.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我準備好了。

Content: It's like this, like this.
Content_zh: 像這樣，像這樣。

Content: No, don't use that one! Oh, god, it's going to be the one you use.
Content_zh: 不，別用那個！哦，天啊，它將會是你用的那個。

Content: I was doing my Magnum face.
Content_zh: 我在做我的 Magnum 面孔。

Content: Dutton: I mean, I guess people have put money down.
Content_zh: Dutton: 我的意思是，我猜人們已經投入了資金。

Content: Some people have put a lot of money down.
Content_zh: 有些人已經投入了很多資金。

Content: Are you feeling real pressure to make sure it's good? Like more so than your other games?
Content_zh: 你是否感到真正的壓力，確保它很好？ 比你其他的遊戲更有壓力嗎？

Content: Schafer: You know, people always ask that and I'm wondering what they thought I was going to do before.
Content_zh: Schafer: 你知道，人們總是問這個，我在想他們之前認為我會做什麼。

Content: Dutton: Take it and run.
Content_zh: Dutton: 拿去然後跑。

Content: Schafer: I can't wait to make this crappy game.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我等不及要做這款爛遊戲了。

Content: Schafer: I don't know.
Content_zh: Schafer: 我不知道。

Content: I mean, I was scared about some things that will happen on the project, which is, did we already talk about people being disappointed?
Content_zh: 我的意思是，我對專案中將會發生的一些事情感到害怕，那就是，我們已經討論過人們會感到失望嗎？

Content: Well, once we talk about what the game actually is, we talk about this boy and this girl,
Content_zh: 嗯，一旦我們談論這款遊戲實際上是什麼，我們談論這個男孩和這個女孩，

Content: there's going to be some people who are disappointed that it's not about an armadillo or spider or whatever they hoped it would be.
Content_zh: 會有一些人會失望，因為它不是關於犰狳或蜘蛛，或者他們希望的其他東西。

Content: There's a game.
Content_zh: 有一款遊戲。

Content: But it just collapsed from infinite possibility into this one particular game.
Content_zh: 但它只是不停地從無限可能性坍縮成這一款特定的遊戲。

Content: The Internet: See, the Internet has just given you a lot of money.
Content_zh: 互聯網: 你看，互聯網剛剛給了你很多錢。

Content: Over two million dollars.
Content_zh: 超過兩百萬美元。

Content: Now, if it appeared that you were wasting this money to make an inferior product, that would be very disappointing.
Content_zh: 現在，如果看起來你是在浪費這些錢來製作一個劣質產品，那將會非常令人失望。

Content: Schafer: I think people who think, there're a lot of people who ask me, do you feel a lot of pressure now, are you scared?
Content_zh: Schafer: 我認為有很多人會問我，你現在感到很大壓力嗎，你害怕嗎？

Content: And I think they just don't realize what I do all day, 'cause a lot of my day is like, you know, in the past year,
Content_zh: 而我覺得他們只是不明白我整天在做什麼，因為我一天的大部分時間都是，知道的，過去一年，

Content: it's been like, look at the bank account.
Content_zh: 就像，看一下銀行賬戶。

Content: There's no money in there. I guess I'll fire everyone today.
Content_zh: 裡面沒有錢。我想我今天會解雇所有人。

Content: You know what I mean? That's, that's pressure. That's scary.
Content_zh: 你知道我的意思嗎？那是壓力。那很可怕。

Content: Like I'm sweating now just thinking about that.
Content_zh: 像是我現在只是想到那件事就開始流汗了。

Content: And I don't have to worry about that for a long time.
Content_zh: 而且我不必為此擔心很長一段時間。

Content: And that's great.
Content_zh: 那太好了。

Content: But also, sitting around thinking about what my hero should do until Act Three, like that is the most easy, pleasant part of my day.
Content_zh: 但同時，坐在一旁思考我的英雄在第三幕之前應該做什麼，這是我一天中最輕鬆、最愉快的部分。

Content: You know, the time I spend locked in my office in the morning writing is like, I feel like I'm a kid again, 'cause this is like, that's the easy part of my job.
Content_zh: 你知道的，我早上鎖在辦公室寫作的時間，就像我又變回孩子一樣，因為這就像是我工作中輕鬆的部分。

Content: And you know, over the past 20 years I've built a company, which puts a lot of things added onto that.
Content_zh: 你知道的，在過去的20年裡我建立了一家公司，這給那個加上了很多東西。

Content: Like thinking about business. Thinking about HR.
Content_zh: 像是思考業務。思考人力資源。

Content: Thinking about negotiating a deal with a publisher and thinking about payroll and then thinking about team management
Content_zh: 思考與出版商談判交易，思考薪資，然後思考團隊管理

Content: and who should be the next project leader and what game should they work on.
Content_zh: 以及誰應該是下一個項目負責人，他們應該做哪款遊戲。

Content: And these two people aren't getting along.
Content_zh: 而且這兩個人相處不好。

Content: The building's going to turn off our power on Thursday.
Content_zh: 大樓將在星期四關閉我們的電源。

Content: And there's all these things, like this is what, like the totality of the company.
Content_zh: 還有所有這些事情，像是公司的整體。

Content: These are all things I think about.
Content_zh: 這些都是我思考的事情。

Content: And just me sitting in my office with my notebook is like a little vacation.
Content_zh: 而且我只是在辦公室裡坐著，拿著筆記本，就像是一個小假期。

Content: Like, you know what, then a spaceship could come down and yeah, it'd be great.
Content_zh: 就像，你知道的，那麼一艘太空船可能會降落，那會很棒。

Content: So I'm having a blast with that stuff.
Content_zh: 所以我在做那些事情時非常愉快。

Content: [music] Schafer: Maybe they're just in it for the documentary.
Content_zh: [音樂] Schafer: 也許他們只是為了紀錄片。

Content: I think a lot of people are.
Content_zh: 我想很多人是這樣的。

Content: And in the process, I think people, you know, want to see the creative process and the story of us making the game.
Content_zh: 在這個過程中，我覺得人們，知道的，想看到創作過程和我們製作遊戲的故事。

Content: There's a difference, obviously, telling the story.
Content_zh: 顯然，講述故事是有區別的。

Content: But who knows?
Content_zh: 但誰知道呢？

Content: They'll get the game, they'll start it up and they'll be like, oh, yeah!
Content_zh: 他們會拿到遊戲，啟動它，然後會說，哦，對！

Content: I have to point-and-click all this stuff? Ah!
Content_zh: 我得點擊所有這些東西？啊！

Content: And now I don't know what to do.
Content_zh: 而現在我不知道該做什麼。

Content: I have to think about a solution to a, ugh.
Content_zh: 我得想一個解決方案，嗯。

Content: But who cares? We got their money, right?
Content_zh: 但誰在乎呢？我們拿到了他們的錢，對吧？

Content: Am I right, you guys?
Content_zh: 我說得對嗎，大家？

Content: Just kidding.
Content_zh: 開玩笑的。

Content: It's going to be awesome. You're going to love it.
Content_zh: 它會非常棒。你們會喜歡的。

Content: [music]
